item.value: repertory Id
Provides an easy way to collect diagnostics in a list.
Recursive Task
Double Adder
dying worker

Performs cleanup and bookkeeping for a dying worker. Called * only from worker threads. Unless completedAbruptly is set, * assumes that workerCount has already been adjusted to account * for exit. This method removes thread from worker set, and * possibly terminates the pool or replaces the worker if either * it exited due to user task exception or if fewer than * corePoolSize workers are running or queue is non-empty but * there are no workers.
completed Abruptly
Eligible to terminate
Common form of interruptIdleWorkers, to avoid having to * remember what the boolean argument means.
interrupt Idle Workers
ONLY ONE
Recheck while holding lock.
Main worker run loop. Repeatedly gets tasks from queue and * executes them, while coping with a number of issues:
Performs blocking or timed wait for a task, depending on * current configuration settings, or returns null if this worker
Attempts to CAS-increment the workerCount field of ctl.

Executes the given task sometime in the future. The task may execute in a new thread or in an existing pooled thread. If the task cannot be submitted for execution, either because this executor has been shutdown or because its capacity has been reached, the task is handled by the current RejectedExecutionHandler.

If a task can be successfully queued, then we still need * to double-check whether we should have added a thread * (because existing ones died since last checking) or that * the pool shut down since entry into this method. So we * recheck state and if necessary roll back the enqueuing if * stopped, or start a new thread if there are none.

If fewer than corePoolSize threads are running, try to * start a new thread with the given command as its first * task. The call to addWorker atomically checks runState and * workerCount, and so prevents false alarms that would add * threads when it shouldn't, by returning false.
The default rejected execution handler
the handler to use when execution is blocked * because the thread bounds and queue capacities are reached
the queue to use for holding tasks before they are * executed. This queue will hold only the {@code Runnable} * tasks submitted by the {@code execute} method.
when the number of threads is greater than * the core, this is the maximum time that excess idle threads * will wait for new tasks before terminating.
the number of threads to keep in the pool, even * if they are idle, unless {@code allowCoreThreadTimeOut} is set
FutureTask extension to enqueue upon completion
Access Control Context
the AccessControlContext to inherit, or * AccessController.getContext() if null
For autonumbering anonymous threads
